Input Sets

Lesson
objectives

Identify the parent containers for an Input Set
Describe Input Set reuse and shared logic
Create a shared logic input set

Create a reusable input set

Differentiate between an Input Set and Input
Set Ref element

User Story: Add Basic Info to Person Info card a

“The Public ID and Created On fields should be displayed on the Details screen’s
Person Info card, similarly to the Summary screen’s Basics card.”

— Insurance Company business analysts

Description

Valid unti

Input Set

Gi

* Set of atomic widgets grouped together
+ Could be reused together

* Common visibility / editability condition could be
applied across multiple widgets

* The input set could be targeted with a partial
page update to improve UI performance
* Input Sets fit some attributes of the primary
containers
* They can contain atomic widgets and organize
them into logical groups
« BUT:
+ Input Sets must be embedded into Detail View
Panels
* Cannot be referenced by secondary views

* Cannot have a toolbar directly associated with
them

| Widgets for Input Sets

¢ Input sets can contain
* Input widgets, input dividers, labels, list view panels and other input sets
¢ Input sets cannot contain
* Input columns

I Inline widget and PCF file comparison a

¢ Differences: ¢ Differences:
+ Not reusable * Reusable
Inherits parent root object * Takes a root object
* Created as a List View widget in the * Created as separate PCF file and
parent container’s PCF file filename ends with InputSet
¢ Similarities: ¢ Similarities:
* It can exercise control over all elements « It can exercise control over all elements
to implement shared logic to implement shared logic
* It can be targeted by a partial page * It can be targeted by a partial page
update request update request

If the container is likely to be needed in multiple places, create a reusable PCF file

I Example: shared logic

¢ Widgets placed within input set

¢ Visibility and/or editability set at
input set level
¢ Example:

« If the root object is of type
ABCompanyVendor, then
FinancialPersonnellnputSet is visible

¢ Eliminates the need to configure
the individual widget properties for
a group of related widgets

I Example: Partial Page Update Gi

¢ Aset of widgets needs to be shown/hidden dynamically based on a condition

« For example, the Date Input Cell widget become visible when the user selects Yes

« No need to update the whole HTML page

* putting the widgets in an Input Set and updating only that Input Set’s HTML code improves the
performance significantly Qualification

Question

_— — Whatare the primary use cases for input sets?

¢
4
¢

SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

Answer fa

_— — Whatare the primary use cases for input sets?

¢
4
¢

Possible answers: (1) Reuse of widgets across detail view panels, (2) or logic shared
for a group of widgets such as editability and/or visibility (3) or targeted page update.

SS See ee oe eee eee eo

Question

_— — Which of the following can be included in input sets:

¢
“ a) Embedded list views

b) Inputs
ce) Input columns
d) Input dividers
e) Labels

SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

Answer

_— — Which of the following can be included in input sets:

¢
“ a) Embedded list views

b) Inputs
ce) Input columns
d) Input dividers
e) Labels

The correct answers are:

Embedded list views, Inputs, Input dividers, and Labels.

SS See ee oe eee eee eo

Question G

_— — Whatis the difference between the "input set" widget and the "input set
oo ref" widget?

SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

Answer fa

_— — Whatis the difference between the "input set" widget and the "input set
o ref" widget?
¢

The InputSet widget groups widgets together and is placed within an input column
within a detail view panel. You use an InputSetRef widget to reference an Input Set
PCF file. An Input Set PCF can be referenced by one or more InputSetRef widgets.
Input Set PCFs are reusable input sets.

SS See ee oe eee eee eo
